cart_detail_2: Operates within the Grand Mosque and surrounding areas
cart_detail_3: Service is free for elderly and disabled pilgrims

wheelchair_detail_3: Service is free for all pilgrims
service_info: Service availability may vary based on location and demand. Your request will be processed as soon as possible.
service_tip_1: Request services at least 30 minutes before your required time
service_tip_2: Be precise about your pickup location to facilitate easy pickup
service_tip_3: Keep your phone accessible to receive calls from service providers
service_tip_4: Cancel unneeded requests to allow others to use the service

missing_person_description: Report a missing person to get help from authorities and other pilgrims
missing_person_warning: This form is for reporting missing persons during Hajj and Umrah. For immediate assistance, please contact emergency services.
description_help: Describe the person's appearance, clothing, and any identifying features
photo_help: Upload a recent photo of the missing person (optional)
missing_tip_1: Remain calm and retrace your steps to common meeting points
missing_tip_2: Provide a recent photo of the missing person if available
missing_tip_3: Note the exact location and time when you last saw the person
missing_tip_4: Check nearby medical centers and lost & found offices
rituals_description: Step-by-step guides for performing rituals correctly
sai_description: Ritual walking between Safa and Marwah
other_rituals_description: Guides for other Hajj and Umrah rituals
tawaf_description_full: Tawaf is the ritual circumambulation of the Kaaba performed by Muslims as part of the Umrah and Hajj pilgrimages. It involves walking around the Kaaba seven times in a counterclockwise direction.
sai_description_full: Sa'i is the ritual walking back and forth seven times between the hills of Safa and Marwah, located near the Kaaba in Mecca. It symbolizes Hajar's search for water for her son Ismail.
tawaf_step1_desc: Before starting Tawaf, ensure you are properly prepared:
tawaf_step1_item1: Be in a state of Wudu (ritual purification)
tawaf_step1_item2: Men should ensure their right shoulder is exposed (for Umrah Tawaf)
tawaf_step1_item4: Prepare yourself mentally and physically for the ritual
tawaf_step1_note: It's preferable to perform Tawaf when the area is less crowded, if possible.
tawaf_step2_desc: Position yourself correctly to begin Tawaf:
tawaf_step2_item1: Start from the Black Stone (Hajar al-Aswad) corner
tawaf_step2_item2: If possible, kiss or touch the Black Stone. If not, face it and point to it with your right hand saying 'Bismillah, Allahu Akbar'
tawaf_step2_item3: Ensure the Kaaba is on your left side throughout the Tawaf
tawaf_step2_note: During crowded times, it's better to simply point towards the Black Stone rather than trying to touch it.
tawaf_step3_desc: Complete seven rounds around the Kaaba:
tawaf_step3_item1: Walk counterclockwise, keeping the Kaaba on your left side
tawaf_step3_item2: Men should walk briskly with short steps for the first three rounds (Ramal) if performing Umrah Tawaf
tawaf_step3_item3: Walk normally for the remaining rounds
tawaf_step3_item4: Recite prayers and supplications during Tawaf
tawaf_step3_item5: When you reach the Yemeni Corner (Rukn al-Yamani), touch it if possible and say 'Bismillah, Allahu Akbar'
tawaf_step3_item6: Between the Yemeni Corner and the Black Stone, recite: 'Rabbana atina fid-dunya hasanatan wa fil-akhirati hasanatan wa qina adhaban-nar'
tawaf_step3_item7: Each round ends when you reach the Black Stone again
tawaf_step3_note: One complete circuit around the Kaaba counts as one round. You must complete seven rounds for a valid Tawaf.
tawaf_step4_item2: Recite the verse: 'Wattakhidhu min maqami Ibrahima musalla'
tawaf_step4_item3: Perform two rakahs of prayer behind Maqam Ibrahim (if possible) or anywhere in the mosque
tawaf_step4_note: If the area around Maqam Ibrahim is very crowded, you can pray the two rakahs anywhere in the Haram.
tawaf_step5_item1: Proceed to the Zamzam well area
tawaf_step5_item2: Drink Zamzam water to your satisfaction
tawaf_step5_item3: Make dua while drinking Zamzam water
tawaf_step5_note: The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) said: 'Zamzam water is for whatever it is drunk for.'
tawaf_map_description: This diagram shows the path to follow during Tawaf, starting from the Black Stone and circling counterclockwise seven times.
general_tawaf_dua_translation: Glory be to Allah, and all praise is due to Allah, and there is no deity except Allah, and Allah is the Greatest. There is no power and no strength except with Allah, the Most High, the Most Great.
between_rukn_yamani_and_black_stone: Between Rukn Yamani and Black Stone
rabbana_dua_translation: Our Lord, give us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and save us from the punishment of the Fire.
supplication_note: You may recite these supplications or any other prayers of your choice during Tawaf. It's also acceptable to make personal supplications in your own language.
tawaf_mistake_1: Starting or ending at the wrong position (Tawaf must start and end at the Black Stone)
tawaf_mistake_2: Walking in the wrong direction (Tawaf must be counterclockwise)
tawaf_mistake_3: Entering the Hijr area (the semi-circular wall) during Tawaf (this area is part of the Kaaba)
tawaf_mistake_4: Breaking Wudu during Tawaf without restarting (if Wudu breaks, you must perform Wudu again and restart the current round)
tawaf_mistake_5: Pushing and shoving to touch the Black Stone or Yemeni Corner (gentle behavior is more important)
tawaf_faq_1_q: What if I lose count of my rounds during Tawaf?
tawaf_faq_1_a: If you're unsure about the number of rounds, take the lesser number that you're certain of and complete the remaining rounds. For example, if you're unsure whether you've completed 3 or 4 rounds, assume you've done 3 and do 4 more.
tawaf_faq_2_q: Is it mandatory to touch the Black Stone?
tawaf_faq_2_a: No, touching or kissing the Black Stone is Sunnah but not mandatory. If it's crowded, it's better to simply face it and point towards it while saying 'Bismillah, Allahu Akbar'.
tawaf_faq_3_q: What if I need to use the restroom during Tawaf?
tawaf_faq_3_a: If you need to break your Tawaf for a valid reason, make a mental note of the round you completed, go perform Wudu, and then return to continue from where you left off.
tawaf_faq_4_q: Is there a specific dua for each round of Tawaf?
tawaf_faq_4_a: There is no specific dua assigned for each round. You can recite any dua, Quranic verses, or dhikr that you know. The important thing is to maintain a state of remembrance of Allah throughout.
sai_step1_desc: Before starting Sa'i, ensure you are properly prepared:
sai_step1_item1: Wudu is recommended but not required for Sa'i
sai_step1_item2: Sa'i should be performed after Tawaf
sai_step1_item3: Make your intention (niyyah) for performing Sa'i
sai_step1_note: Ensure you have the physical ability to complete all seven rounds. The distance of one complete circuit (from Safa to Marwah and back) is approximately 450 meters.
sai_step2_desc: Begin the Sa'i ritual at Mount Safa:
sai_step2_item1: Climb onto the hill of Safa (or the designated area)
sai_step2_item2: Face the direction of the Kaaba
sai_step2_item3: Recite: 'Innas-safa wal marwata min sha'a'irillah' (Indeed, Safa and Marwah are among the symbols of Allah)
sai_step2_item4: Raise your hands in supplication and make dua
safa_dua_translation: Indeed, Safa and Marwah are among the symbols of Allah.
sai_step3_item1: Walk at a normal pace towards Marwah
sai_step3_item2: When you reach the green lights (marked by green pillars), men should jog or walk briskly while women continue at a normal pace
sai_step3_item3: After passing the green lights, resume walking at a normal pace
sai_step3_item4: Recite prayers and supplications during your walk
sai_step3_note: The area with green lights marks the valley between the hills where Hajar ran frantically searching for water.
sai_step4_item1: Climb onto the hill of Marwah (or the designated area)
sai_step4_item2: Face the direction of the Kaaba
sai_step4_item3: Raise your hands in supplication and make dua, similar to what you did at Safa
marwah_dua_note: You can make the same supplications at Marwah as you did at Safa, and add any personal prayers you wish.
sai_step5_desc: Complete all seven legs of Sa'i:
sai_step5_item1: Going from Safa to Marwah counts as one leg
sai_step5_item2: Returning from Marwah to Safa counts as the second leg
sai_step5_item3: Continue until you complete seven legs, ending at Marwah
sai_step5_item4: Make dua after completing the seven legs
sai_step5_note: Count your legs carefully. Sa'i begins at Safa and ends at Marwah (after 7 legs).
sai_map_description: This diagram shows the path between Safa and Marwah, including the area where men should jog (indicated by green lights).

qibla_description: Find the direction of the Kaaba from your current location for prayer
calibration_instructions: To calibrate your compass, move your device in a figure-8 pattern several times.
compass_not_supported: Compass not supported on your device
compass_interference: Compass may be affected by magnetic interference. For best results, keep away from electronic devices.
qibla_definition: The Qibla is the direction Muslims face during prayer. It points toward the Kaaba in Mecca, Saudi Arabia.
qibla_instruction_2: Hold your device flat in your hand
qibla_instruction_3: The arrow will point to the Qibla direction
qibla_instruction_4: Calibrate if the compass seems inaccurate

invite_code_help: Enter the invite code shared with you
no_groups: You haven't joined any groups yet
sharing_tip_1: Share your location only with trusted individuals or groups
sharing_tip_2: Update your location regularly when moving to new areas
sharing_tip_3: Enable real-time sharing during crowded events
sharing_tip_4: Disable sharing when not needed to save battery

welcome_message: Welcome to the Hajj & Umrah Smart Platform
platform_description: A comprehensive solution for pilgrims, guardians, and authorities
services_description: Essential services to make your pilgrimage easier and safer
cta_description: Register now to access all features of the Hajj & Umrah Smart Platform
qibla_fact_1: The Qibla direction changes depending on your location on Earth
qibla_fact_2: Muslims worldwide face the Kaaba during prayers
qibla_fact_3: The Kaaba is approximately in the center of the Muslim world
qibla_tip: For best accuracy, use this tool in an open area away from magnetic interference
prayers_supplications_description: Essential duas for Hajj and Umrah rituals
essential_duas_hajj_umrah: Essential Duas for Hajj and Umrah
talbiyah_translation: Here I am, O Allah, here I am. Here I am, You have no partner, here I am. Verily all praise and blessings are Yours, and all sovereignty. You have no partner.
talbiyah_when: Recited frequently throughout Hajj and Umrah, especially when moving between rituals
safa_marwah_translation: Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest, Allah is the Greatest. There is no deity except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent.
safa_marwah_when: Recited at the beginning of Sa'i between Safa and Marwah
dua_between_rukn_hajar: Dua Between Rukn Yamani and Black Stone
rabbana_dua_when: Recited between Rukn Yamani and the Black Stone during Tawaf
prophet_saying_arafat: The best supplication is the supplication on the Day of Arafah.
arafat_best_translation: There is no deity except Allah alone, He has no partner. To Him belongs the dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent.
forgiveness_translation: O Allah, forgive all my sins, the small and large, the first and last, the public and private.
entering_masjid_translation: O Allah, open the doors of Your mercy for me.
leaving_masjid_translation: O Allah, I ask You from Your bounty.
zamzam_translation: O Allah, I ask You for beneficial knowledge, plentiful provision, and healing from every illness.

ritual_guides_description: Comprehensive guides for all Hajj and Umrah rituals
ihram_short_desc: State of purity and intention for Hajj/Umrah
umrah_step1_desc: Enter the state of Ihram at the Miqat
umrah_step3_desc: Perform Sa'i between Safa and Marwah
halq_taqsir: Shaving or shortening of hair (Halq or Taqsir)
umrah_step4_desc: Complete Umrah by shaving or cutting hair
umrah_note: Women should only cut a small portion of hair
ihram_hajj_short_desc: Enter state of Ihram from Miqat
mina_day8_short_desc: Travel to Mina and stay until sunrise
arafat_short_desc: Stand at Arafat from noon to sunset
muzdalifah_short_desc: Collect pebbles and spend night in Muzdalifah
halq_hajj_short_desc: Shave or shorten hair after sacrifice
hajj_days_note: Dates shown are approximate and vary each year based on the Islamic calendar
masjid_al_haram_map_desc: Detailed map of the Grand Mosque in Mecca
hajj_sites_map_desc: Map of all Hajj sites between Mecca and Mina
question_description: Browse our FAQs for answers to common questions about Hajj and Umrah
hajj_day13_activity1: Stone all three Jamarat (if still in Mina)
hajj_day13_activity2: Perform farewell Tawaf before leaving Mecca
hajj_calendar_note: These dates are based on the Islamic lunar calendar and change approximately 10-12 days earlier each year
arafat_description_full: A comprehensive guide to the Day of Arafat, the most important day of Hajj. Learn about its significance, rituals, supplications, and practical tips.
arafat_significance_text: The Day of Arafat is the pinnacle of Hajj. It occurs on the 9th day of Dhul-Hijjah when pilgrims stand on the plain of Arafat from noon until sunset in earnest supplication and devotion.
prophet_saying_about_arafat: The Prophet (PBUH) said: 'Hajj is Arafat' (Abu Dawud). This shows the immense importance of standing at Arafat.
arafat_historical_point1: Place where Adam and Eve reunited after descending from Paradise
arafat_historical_point2: Location where Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) delivered his Farewell Sermon
arafat_historical_point3: Site where the verse 'This day I have perfected for you your religion' was revealed
arafat_historical_point4: Considered the place where sins are forgiven and supplications are answered
arafat_step1_item1: Perform Ghusl (ritual bath) in the morning
arafat_step1_item4: Make intention for Wuqoof at Arafat
arafat_step1_item5: Leave Mina for Arafat after Fajr prayer
arafat_step1_note: It is Sunnah to be in a state of Ihram for Wuqoof at Arafat.
arafat_step2_item1: Find a suitable place to stay (preferably near Jabal Rahmah)
arafat_step2_item2: Spend time in Dhikr, Dua and Quran recitation
arafat_step2_item3: Listen to the Khutbah at Masjid Namirah (if possible)
arafat_step2_item4: Combine Zuhr and Asr prayers at Zuhr time
arafat_step2_note: The time of Wuqoof begins from Zawal (after midday) until sunset.
arafat_step3_desc: What to do during the stay at Arafat:
arafat_step3_item3: Recite the best Dua: 'La ilaha illallah...'
arafat_step3_item5: Avoid idle talk and worldly matters
arafat_step3_note: The best Dua is the one made on the Day of Arafat.
arafat_step4_item3: Proceed to Muzdalifah for Maghrib and Isha prayers
arafat_step4_item4: Collect pebbles for Rami (stoning) on the way
arafat_step4_note: It is essential to stay at Arafat until sunset to complete the Wuqoof.
arafat_map_description: The plain of Arafat covers an area of approximately 10.4 square kilometers with clearly marked boundaries.
jabal_rahmah_desc: The hill where Prophet Adam and Eve reunited and where the Prophet (PBUH) stood during his Farewell Pilgrimage.
namira_mosque_desc: The mosque where the Khutbah of Hajj is delivered on the Day of Arafat.
urna_valley_desc: The valley where the Prophet (PBUH) camped during his Hajj.
arafat_boundaries_desc: Arafat has clear boundaries marked by signs. Standing outside these boundaries does not count as Wuqoof.
timing_warning: Missing the Wuqoof at Arafat invalidates the Hajj. Be extremely careful with timings.
best_dua_translation: There is no deity except Allah alone, with no partner. His is the dominion, and His is the praise, and He is over all things competent.
seeking_forgiveness_translation: Our Lord, give us in this world good and in the Hereafter good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire.
arafat_supplication_note: The Day of Arafat is the best day for making Dua. Be sincere and ask for all your needs.
arafat_mistake_2: Wasting time in idle talk instead of worship
arafat_mistake_3: Standing outside the boundaries of Arafat
arafat_mistake_5: Not combining Zuhr and Asr prayers
arafat_tip_1: Carry a portable prayer mat and umbrella for shade
arafat_tip_2: Bring sufficient water to stay hydrated
arafat_tip_4: Use a dua list to stay focused
arafat_tip_5: Stay with your group to avoid getting lost
arafat_tip_6: Be patient and help fellow pilgrims
error_occurred: An error occurred, please try again later
delete_confirmation: Are you sure you want to delete this missing person report?
select_request: Select a request to view details
